The U: S. Department of Agriculture (USDA) announced a change in work requirements for its Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program (SNAP), which is projected to cut off 688,000 people from food stamps.
The change specifically affects able: bodied adults between the ages of 18 and 49 without dependents, according to a USDA press release.
Brandon Lipps: deputy undersecretary for USDA's Food Nutrition and Consumer Services, stated in a press call that the agency estimates 688,000 people will lose access to the program due to the rule change.
